summary: The Cable Transparency Act amends the Communications Act of 1934 regarding cable franchises. It addresses franchise terms, termination, and the elimination or modification of requirements within existing franchises. Key changes include clarifying procedures for cable operators to request modifications, setting deadlines for franchising authorities to respond, and defining the conditions under which a franchise can be terminated or revoked. The bill also includes technical amendments to the Act and specifies an effective date and application.
